title.narrative: STATUTORY SERVICE PROVIDERS HAVE INCREASED AUTHORITY..

description.narrative: Statutory service providers have increased authority, resources and knowledge to provide quality child protection services to the most vulnerable boys and girls in Afghanistan, which contributes to Access To Justice, Harmful Practices (Fgm/C And Child Marriage), Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: CHILD PROTECTION outcome: Girls and boys vulnerable and exposed to violence, abuse and exploitation are better protected by institutional (formal and informal) and legislative frameworks which include services and systems.

related-activity.ref: 0060/A0/07/885 PROTECTION FROM ABUSE, VIOLENCE AND EXPL

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Statutory service providers have increased authority, resources and knowledge to provide quality child protection services to the most vulnerable boys and girls in Afghanistan

description.narrative: 233,742 children had their births registered in the first half of the year. With the support of Child Protection Action Networks in 34 provinces, 61,022 children who were at risk or victims of violence benefitted from improved specialized age-appropriate, gender-sensitive child protection services, including in areas affected by humanitarian crisis. 500 children were released from detention facilities as part of containment measure for the COVID-19 pandemic. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:30/07/2020
